author: Special Correspondent
text: In a significant change in the bureaucracy, the State government appointed Dr. B..Chandra Mohan as the Commissioner of Chennai Corporation on Wednesday. Vikram Kapur, the incumbent, will replace Dr. Chandra Mohan as the managing director of Chennai Metrowater. The same day, the government also changed the Chennai Collector. E. Sundaravalli, Chennai Collector, has been posted as Tiruvallur Collector, according to a government order signed by Chief Secretary K. Gnanadesikan, Tiruvallur Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao has been posted as Madurai Collector in place of L. Subramanian who has been transferred and posted as Joint Commissioner of Revenue Administration in place of M. Jayaraman who has retired. Tirupur Collector G. Govindaraj has been posted as the Chennai Collector. T.P. Rajesh, Krishnagiri Collector, has been posted as Karur Collector in place of S. Jayandhi who is now Tirupur Collector. C. Kathiravan, Madurai Corporation Commissioner, has been posted as Krishnagiri Collector. S. Natarajan, additional director of Rural Development and Panchayat Raj, has been posted as Ramanathapuram Collector in the place of K. Nanthakumar who will take charge as Perambalur Collector.
title: Chennai Corporation gets new commissioner
